title: 58 Clean-Eating Dinner Recipes (That Taste Dirty)
author: Melissa Kravitz Hoeffner
description: These 58 clean eating dinner recipes (think minimal processed foods) will help kick start your healthy menu without leaving you feeling deprived as your best year yet begins.
cleaned_text: New year, new menu. With a little planning and a lot of determination, you can totally eat healthier this year...without resorting to plain old [salad](https://www.purewow.com/food/winter-salads) every single night, because honestly, that sounds miserable. These 58 recipes are here to help kick start your [clean eating](https://www.purewow.com/food/Eat-clean-recipes) (think minimal processed foods) without feeling deprived as your best year yet begins. And did we mention a lot of them are [big-batch](https://www.purewow.com/food/big-batch-recipes-for-a-crowd)? Hello, bonus leftovers! 58 Clean-Eating Dinner Recipes (That Taste Dirty) New year, new menu. With a little planning and a lot of determination, you can totally eat healthier this year...without resorting to plain old 1. [Gluten-Free Cauliflower Gnocchi Pomodoro](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/gluten-free-cauliflower-gnocchi-pomodoro-recipe) - Time Commitment: 50 minutes - Why We Love It: gluten free, vegetarian, high protein Your kitchen may not be clean after making this veg-packed [gnocchi](https://www.purewow.com/food/easy-gnocchi-recipes) from scratch, but at least your dinner will be. This hearty dish is gluten-free and vegetarian, and because it serves six, you can host a gnocchi-loving group. 2. [Vegan Slow-Cooker Detox Coconut Soup](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/vegan-slow-cooker-detox-coconut-soup) - Time Commitment: 7 hours, 15 minutes - Why We Love It: vegan, slow cooker recipe, <500 calories Yep, you can be lazy and healthy. This slow cooker soup takes minimal effort and offers tons of creaminess, plus bright veggies. - Time Commitment: 35 minutes - Why We Love It: vegan, keto, low sugar This luscious curry is bursting with flavor and plenty of add-ins. Enjoy it with [cauliflower rice](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/cauliflower-rice) or a base of cooked ancient grains. 5. [30-Minute One-Pot Cheater's Bouillabaisse](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/30-minute-one-pot-cheaters-bouillabaisse) - Time Commitment: 30 minutes - Why We Love It: <30 minutes, crowd-pleaser, high protein Hello, gorgeous. All you need is a small pot to make this French-style seafood stew. 6. [Keto Sheet-Pan Chicken and Rainbow Veggies](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/keto-sheet-pan-chicken-rainbow-veggies) - Time Commitment: 35 minutes - Why We Love It: sheet pan recipe, keto, beginner-friendly So easy, so healthy and still so beautiful. Add some color to a drab January night with this clean-eating go-to. 7. [Veggie Niçoise Salad with Red Curry Green Beans](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/veggie-nicoise-salad-red-curry-green-beans) - Time Commitment: 1 hour - Why We Love It: vegetarian, make ahead Spice up the classic Niçoise salad with curry paste-covered green beans. Throw some tuna, salmon or tofu on top if you want extra protein. 8. [Radicchio, Lentil and Apple Salad with Vegan Cashew Dressing](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/radicchio-lentil-apple-salad-vegan-cashew-dressing) - Time Commitment: 35 minutes (+ soaking time) - Why We Love It: gluten free, dairy free, crowd-pleaser So decadent, you wouldn't think it counts as a salad, but it totally does. Memorize this cashew dressing recipe, because you'll want to slather it on everything. 9. [Spicy Whole Roasted Cauliflower](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/whole-roasted-cauliflower) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 30 minutes - Why We Love It: special occasion-worthy, <500 calories, low sugar It's cauliflower steak night! Serve a nice hunk of this roasted cauli on top of salad, cooked greens or whole [grains](https://www.purewow.com/food/high-protein-grains) to round out your dinner. 10. [Pesto Zoodles](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/pesto-zoodles-recipe) - Time Commitment: 25 minutes - Why We Love It: <30 minutes, <500 calories, gluten free These delightful zoodles are the answer to your carb cravings (especially when you load them with sauce and cheese). 11. [Shrimp with Cauliflower 'Grits' and Arugula](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/shrimp-and-cauliflower-grits) - Time Commitment: 30 minutes - Why We Love It: gluten free, low carb Cauliflower keeps this [classic Southern dish](https://www.purewow.com/food/soul-food-recipes) low in carbs, and it's perhaps even more delicious than the original version. - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 45 minutes - Why We Love It: <10 ingredients, dairy free, gluten free Roasting fresh tomatoes with garlic and onion adds so many layers of flavor to this super simple soup. - Time Commitment: 25 minutes - Why We Love It: <30 minutes, <500 calories Prepare to be deceived by veggies. Seriously. 14. [Lemon and Herb Roast Chicken](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/Lemon-and-Herb-Roast-Chicken) - Time Commitment: - Why We Love It: There may be no dinner as elegant as an impeccably roasted chicken. And once you eat it, you'll have plenty of [leftovers](https://www.purewow.com/food/leftover-chicken-dinner-recipes) to add to salads and use for sandwiches. 15. [Zucchini Noodle Pad See Ew](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/zucchini-noodle-pad-see-ew) - Time Commitment: 50 minutes - Why We Love It: gluten free, high protein Thinly slicing a whole zucchini with a vegetable peeler creates a long, ribbon-like noodle that rivals the real thing. Your favorite Thai restaurant is going to miss seeing you after you master this recipe. 16. [Baked Sesame Ginger Salmon in Parchment](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/sesame-ginger-salmon-in-parchment) - Time Commitment: 30 minutes - Why We Love It: <500 calories, high protein, dairy free So much flavor in one little paper packet. (Plus, no dirty dishes.) 17. [Low-Carb Beef and Broccoli Stir Fry](https://iamafoodblog.com/easy-keto-friendly-low-carb-beef-and-broccoli-stir-fry/) - Time Commitment: 20 minutes - Why We Love It: <30 minutes, keto, low carb This [keto-friendly](https://www.purewow.com/food/fall-ketogenic-recipes) stir fry is super quick to prep, and you can easily make it with freezer and pantry ingredients. - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 30 minutes - Why We Love It: one pan, vegetarian, <500 calories So photogenic, so tasty, so healthy. Queue up Ratatouille on Disney+ to watch while you eat, naturally. 19. [Spiralized Winter Vegetable Gratin](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/spiralized-winter-vegetable-gratin) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 40 minutes - Why We Love It: calories, crowd-pleaser, lightened up casserole. 20. [Eggplant Pizza](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/eggplant-pizza-recipe) - Time Commitment: 35 minutes - Why We Love It: low carb, gluten free Low carb, gluten free and totally delicious, [eggplant](https://www.purewow.com/food/eggplant-side-dishes) is truly the ideal sub for traditional pizza crust. 21. [Rainbow Collard Wraps with Peanut Butter Dipping Sauce](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/rainbow-collard-wraps-peanut-butter-dipping-sauce) - Time Commitment: 30 minutes - Why We Love It: <30 minutes, make ahead, gluten free Eat the rainbow (and actually enjoy your meal) during the heart of dreary January. 22. [Alison Roman's Swordfish with Crushed Olives and Oregano](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/swordfish-crushed-olives-oregano) - Time Commitment: 30 minutes - Why We Love It: <30 minutes, special occasion-worthy, <10 ingredients It's kind of ridiculous that this restaurant-worthy recipe only takes half an hour to prepare and cook. Invite someone you want to impress over for dinner. 23. [Roasted Squash and Tofu with Soy, Honey, Chili and Ginger](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/roasted-squash-tofu-soy-honey-chili-ginger) - Time Commitment: 1 hour - Why We Love It: sheet pan recipe, <500 calories Yep, it's just a basic [sheet pan meal](https://www.purewow.com/food/60-minute-sheet-pan-recipes), but with complex flavors and healthy ingredients. 24. [Chicken with Feta Cheese, Dill, Lemon and Harissa Yogurt](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/chicken-feta-cheese-dill-lemon-harissa-yogurt) - Time Commitment: 50 minutes - Why We Love It: high protein, gluten free This easy and elegant chicken dinner just screams "sweater weather." 25. [Pan-Seared Scallops with Citrusy Corn Succotash](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/pan-seared-scallops-citrusy-corn-succotash) - Time Commitment: 40 minutes - Why We Love It: special occasion-worthy, <10 ingredients, <500 calories This bright recipe will remind you of sunny summer beach days, and all the ingredients are easily available throughout the winter. 26. [Zucchini Carbonara with Parsnip 'Pancetta'](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/zucchini-carbonara-parsnip-pancetta) - Time Commitment: 25 minutes - Why We Love It: <30 minutes, vegetarian, low sugar One of the most indulgent pasta recipes known to carb lovers, but lightened up and [vegetarian](https://www.purewow.com/food/vegetarian-pasta-recipes). 27. [Spicy Lemon-Ginger Chicken Soup](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/spicy-lemon-ginger-chicken-soup) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 15 minutes - Why We Love It: low sugar, gluten free, crowd-pleaser Clear up a winter runny nose with this zingy chicken soup that has just the right amount of spice. 28. Low Carb Zucchini Enchiladas - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 15 minutes - Why We Love It: gluten free, crowd-pleaser, <500 calories [Zucchini](https://www.purewow.com/food/zucchini-recipes) subs in for tortillas in this enchilada recipe, and the filling is customizable, so everyone at the table will love it. 29. [Portobello Mushrooms Stuffed with Barley Risotto](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/stuffed-portobello-mushrooms-barley-risotto) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 15 minutes - Why We Love It: <500 calories, vegetarian, high protein Cooked barley has a naturally creamy consistency, making it an ideal whole grain for a [risotto](https://www.purewow.com/food/risotto-recipes)-style preparation. Amp it up by stuffing your homemade risotto into roasted mushroom caps. 30. [Turmeric White Fish with Peanuts and Chili-Lime Cucumber](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/turmeric-white-fish-peanuts-chili-lime-cucumber) - Time Commitment: 45 minutes - Why We Love It: high protein, <500 calories You can use hake, cod or monkfish in this easy but sophisticated recipe inspired by Vietnamese flavors. 31. [Vegan Kentucky Fried Chick'n](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/vegan-kentucky-fried-chicken) - Time Commitment: 55 minutes - Why We Love It: vegan, high protein OK, it's healthy enough. You deserve a little treat to keep you going. 32. [Greek Yogurt Chicken Salad Stuffed Peppers](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/greek-yogurt-chicken-salad-stuffed-peppers) - Time Commitment: 30 minutes - Why We Love It: make ahead, <30 minutes, gluten free, <500 calories This one goes out to the [mayo](https://www.purewow.com/food/best-vegan-mayo) haters. With Greek yogurt, rice vinegar and plenty of mustard, it's just as creamy and tangy as the original. 33. [Black Bean Plantain Enchilada Bake](https://minimalistbaker.com/black-bean-plantain-enchilada-bake/) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 35 minutes - Why We Love It: gluten free, dairy free, vegan, <10 ingredients Here's proof that healthy dishes don't have to be complicated: This riff on enchiladas needs only ten ingredients to come together. It's also totally vegan and gluten-free. 34. [Creamy Vegan Lentil and Roasted Vegetable Bake](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/vegan-lentil-roasted-vegetable-bake) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 25 minutes - Why We Love It: crowd-pleaser, dairy free Thanks to tahini, [miso](https://www.purewow.com/food/what-is-miso) and a rich cashew cream, you'd never guess that this hearty casserole contains absolutely no dairy. If you want to make it gluten free, just skip the breadcrumb topping (but don't forget the pine nuts). 35. [Quiche with Gluten-Free Sweet Potato Crust](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/quiche-gluten-free-sweet-potato-crust) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 20 minutes - Why We Love It: gluten free, high protein What's better than brinner (aka breakfast for dinner)? When it doesn't leave you feeling weighed down with maple syrup-soaked carbs. (Not that we don't love that from time to time.) 36. [Spinach and White Bean Soup](https://damndelicious.net/2015/01/26/spinach-white-bean-soup/) - Time Commitment: 30 minutes - Why We Love It: <30 minutes, vegetarian, dairy free White beans and orzo meet soft, melt-in-your-mouth [spinach](https://www.purewow.com/food/spinach-recipes) in this hearty recipe. Best of all, it's ready in about 30 minutes. 37. [Turkey and Quinoa Stuffed Bell Peppers](https://themodernproper.com/turkey-stuffed-peppers) - Time Commitment: 40 minutes - Why We Love It: <500 calories, low carb We kind of have a thing for [stuffed bell peppers](https://www.purewow.com/food/stuffed-pepper-recipes)—can you blame us? They're crunchy, pre-portioned and give us an excuse to say we ate the bowl. 38. [Instant Pot Minestrone Soup](https://pinchofyum.com/instant-pot-minestrone-soup) - Time Commitment: 50 minutes - Why We Love It: crowd-pleaser, Instant Pot recipe, vegetarian What did we do to deserve [soup](https://www.purewow.com/food/30-minute-winter-soup-recipes)? It's filling without being heavy, can feed a giant crowd and is basically the O.G. one-pot meal. This one's packed with veggies, beans and, of course, Parm. 39. [Instant Pot Chicken Tikka Masala](https://lexiscleankitchen.com/instant-pot-chicken-tikka-masala/) - Time Commitment: 33 minutes - Why We Love It: Instant Pot recipe, high protein, dairy free, gluten free Takeout, shmakeout. Your trusty pressure cooker will give you an Indian-inspired dish that's just as tasty and takes way less time. (33 minutes, to be exact.) - Time Commitment: 55 minutes - Why We Love It: crowd-pleaser, make ahead, high protein [Chili](https://www.purewow.com/food/what-goes-with-chili) is the ultimate choice for feeding a crowd and it freezes beautifully, too. This one has plenty of corn, beans and spices to keep things interesting. 41. [Kale Salad with Tahini Dressing](https://minimalistbaker.com/abundance-kale-salad-with-savory-tahini-dressing/) - Time Commitment: 30 minutes - Why We Love It: gluten free, vegan The best thing about this salad is that while you can certainly stick to the recipe, you can also add any toppings you have on hand. But whatever you do, don't skimp on the garlicy tahini dressing. 42. [Spicy Black Bean and Quinoa Burritos](https://simple-veganista.com/spicy-black-bean-quinoa-burrito/) - Time Commitment: 30 minutes - Why We Love It: vegan, make ahead These aren't just any burritos...they're freezer burritos. Make a bunch of filling, assemble and stash away for busy nights (or whenever you're feeling lazy). 43. [Red Curry Sheet Pan Chicken with Sweet Potatoes and Crispy Kale](https://feedmephoebe.com/sheet-pan-chicken-recipe/) - Time Commitment: 1 hour - Why We Love It: sheet pan recipe, high protein The [sheet-pan](https://www.purewow.com/food/60-minute-sheet-pan-recipes) meal is our knight in shining armor. Throw as many ingredients as you can fit onto one tray, and in less than an hour, you're eating a maple-y, curry chicken dinner—minimal cleanup required. 44. [Quick Gochujang Lettuce Wraps](https://www.gimmesomeoven.com/gochujang-lettuce-wraps/) - Time Commitment: 20 minutes - We Love It: crowd-pleaser, low carb, <30 minutes Gochujang, a type of Korean chili paste, adds just the right amount of sweet-spicy-funk to these effortless steak lettuce wraps. Don't like steak? Just swap in your favorite protein. 45. [Easy Southwest Black Bean Polenta Casserole](https://www.cottercrunch.com/southwest-black-beans-polenta-casserole/) - Time Commitment: 45 minutes - Why We Love It: one pan, crowd-pleaser, gluten free We know [casseroles](https://www.purewow.com/food/easy-casseroles) have a reputation for being filled with cheese and carbs, but this one is refreshingly wholesome. Beans (for protein) and plenty of vegetables blanketed in polenta—what more could you want? 46. [Easy Greek Sheet Pan Chicken Souvlaki and Potatoes](https://www.halfbakedharvest.com/best-easy-greek-sheet-pan-chicken-souvlaki-and-potatoes/) - Time Commitment: 1 hour - Why We Love It: sheet pan recipe, high protein Once you take a bite, you won't believe how simple this one-pan recipe actually is. All that garlic, dill and balsamic vinegar is deliciously, flavorfully deceiving. 47. [Baked Zucchini 'Ziti' Spirals with Mozzarella](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/baked-zucchini-ziti-spirals) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 10 minutes - Why We Love It: gluten free, crowd-pleaser, <500 calories Just when you thought a baked pasta couldn't be good for you, the glorious zucchini swoops in to save the day. Here it's used in place of noodles for a hearty-yet-healthy take on one of our all-time favorites. 48. Spiced Lamb Meatball and Escarole Soup - Time Commitment: 45 minutes - Why We Love It: one pot, high protein What's more feel-good than a steaming pot of [soup](https://www.purewow.com/food/fall-soup-recipes)? This one tastes like a million bucks (but takes less than an hour to make). 49. [Crispy Tofu Steaks with Broccoli Rabe and Romesco](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/crispy-tofu-steaks-broccoli-rabe-romesco) - Time Commitment: 50 minutes - Why We Love It: vegan, high protein, <500 calories Tofu comes in [all different styles and textures](https://www.purewow.com/food/how-to-prepare-tofu), but our favorite way to eat it is crispy. And if you've never tried it yourself, this simple, flavorful rendition is a good place to start. 50. [Instant Pot Harissa Bean Stew](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/instant-pot-harissa-bean-stew) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 15 minutes - Why We Love It: Instant Pot recipe, high protein, crowd-pleaser, vegetarian This harissa bean stew starts with dried beans but takes only about an hour to make (and that includes the homemade harissa). 51. [Sheet Pan Curried Butternut Squash Soup](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/sheet-pan-curried-butternut-squash-soup) - Time Commitment: 1 hour - Why We Love It: sheet pan recipe, low sugar, <500 calories You've heard of [sheet pan chicken](https://www.purewow.com/food/sheet-pan-chicken-recipes), but soup? Believe it. Roasting the vegetables before pureeing them adds depth of flavor from all that caramelization. 52. [Roasted Vegetable and Lentil Salad with Pine Nut Cream](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/fall-roasted-vegetable-and-lentil-salad-with-pine-nut-cream) - Time Commitment: 45 minutes - Why We Love It: gluten free, dairy free, <500 calories, low sugar No one will guess this is good for you, thanks to the luscious (and vegan!) pine nut cream. 53. [Antoni Porowski's Salmon and Spinach Rice Bowl with Green Tea Broth](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/antoni-porowski-salmon-spinach-rice-bowl-green-tea-broth) - Time Commitment: 40 minutes - Why We Love It: <10 ingredients, low sugar, <500 calories Simple, nutritious and delicious is our new M.O. 54. Salmon with Pesto and Blistered Tomatoes - Time Commitment: 35 minutes - Why We Love It: <10 ingredients, high protein, low carb, low sugar Winter isn't known for its bounty of produce, but luckily, cherry tomatoes are always tasty and easy to find. Roasting them in the oven brings out even more jammy flavor. 55. [Miso-Tahini-Glazed Roasted Eggplant with Farro](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/miso-tahini-glazed-roasted-eggplant-with-farro) - Time Commitment: 35 minutes - Why We Love It: vegan, <500 calories Once you try eggplant like this, you might fall in love. Don't say we didn't warn you. 56. [Garlicky Spinach and Chickpea Soup with Lemon and Pecorino Romano](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/garlicky-spinach-chickpea-soup-lemon-pecorino) - Time Commitment: 50 minutes - Why We Love It: vegetarian, <500 calories, high protein, Mediterranean diet friendly With starring roles from canned chickpeas and baby spinach (plus a few flavor boosters, like onions, fresh garlic, spices and the all-essential fresh lemon juice), this [Mediterranean](https://www.purewow.com/food/mediterranean-diet-dinner-recipes) soup is as flavorful as it is [protein-rich](https://www.purewow.com/food/high-protein-meals). 57. [Lemongrass-Ginger Coconut Grilled Steak](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/anna-stockwell-lemongrass-ginger-coconut-grilled-steak) - Time Commitment: 1 hour, 10 minutes - Why We Love It: high protein, gluten free, dairy free, low sugar This impressive dish is slightly sweet and deeply flavorful, with a "why's this so tasty?" secret ingredient to thank. (It's [fish sauce](https://www.purewow.com/food/what-is-fish-sauce).) 58. [Crispy Chickpeas and Scallops with Garlic-Harissa Oil](https://www.purewow.com/recipes/crispy-chickpeas-scallops-garlic-harissa-oil) - Time Commitment: 25 minutes - Why We Love It: <30 minutes, <500 calories, high protein If you're craving [seafood](https://www.purewow.com/food/summer-seafood-recipes) but sick of the same old salmon, try this recipe. It's just as easy to make, but feels a little more special.
